head.title: On the Waterfront: Parks and Big Dreams

hedline.hl1: On the Waterfront: Parks and Big Dreams

abstract.p: Letter from Andrew Darrell (Waterfront Park Coalition) hails Army Corps of Engineers' approval of Hudson River Park (June 1 article); drawing

block.p: The decision by the Army Corps of Engineers to approve the construction of Hudson River Park is a welcome step toward revitalizing Manhattan's West Side waterfront (front page, June 1).
The decision by the Army Corps of Engineers to approve the construction of Hudson River Park is a welcome step toward revitalizing Manhattan's West Side waterfront (front page, June 1).
The permit is the result of years of public review, including a full state environmental impact statement and in-depth analyses by federal environmental and wildlife agencies.

This intensive review has realized two important goals: a park plan that celebrates the Hudson River with both public open space and an estuarine sanctuary, and conditions written into the permit that add even more habitat protections. With this plan and these permit conditions in place, it is time for all New Yorkers to join together in support of rapid implementation of the park plan.
The writer is executive director of the Waterfront Park Coalition.
